page.title: 19Ecology - Quinton
page.content: Once farmland, the Woodgate Valley Country Park has been put aside for conservation use. The park is maintained by a team of rangers & volunteers. The area covers scrubland with a stream running through it,a pond & a marshy area. This provides a habitat for insects & amphibian creatures, birds, hares & foxes. Recently signs of badgers were found. Wild flowers abound. The park is used by local inhabitants for recreational purposes & by school children for projects.There are opportunities for riding & facilities for disabled people. The classroom, stables,goats & donkey carts are based at Hole Farm. Much still needs to be done to educate people to the proper use of the area but the rangers are working to overcome this by contact with schools & working with children.
